title: Candy bar
data:
**[English]()** • [中文（中国大陆）‎](/wiki/Candy_bar/zh-CN "Candy bar/zh-CN")

| % [![Candy bar.png](/images/f/fb/Candy_bar.png)](/wiki/File:Candy_bar.png) |                                             |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------- |
| Name                                                                       | candy bar                                   |
| Base price                                                                 | 10 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")            |
| Nutrition                                                                  | [100](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition")          |
| Turns to eat                                                               | 1                                           |
| Weight                                                                     | [2](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                  |
| Conduct                                                                    | [vegetarian](/wiki/Conduct#Vegan "Conduct") |

A **candy bar** is a type of [veggy](/wiki/Veggy "Veggy") [comestible](/wiki/Comestible "Comestible") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, and is suitable for [vegetarians](/wiki/Vegetarian "Vegetarian") (but not [vegans](/wiki/Vegan "Vegan")).

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Origin](#Origin)

- [6 Variants](#Variants)

  - [6.1 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [6.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [6.3 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

- [7 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [8 References](#References)

## Generation

Tourists may start with candy bars among their random food items.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

In addition to random generation, candy bars can be sold in health food [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop") and delis.

[Applying](/wiki/Apply "Apply") a [charged](/wiki/Charge "Charge") [horn of plenty](/wiki/Horn_of_plenty "Horn of plenty") has a 1.3% chance of generating one or more candy bars.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

## Description

When eaten, a candy bar confers 100 [nutrition](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition") and takes one action to consume.

Candy bars have labels that can be [read](/wiki/Read "Read"), which naturally breaks [illiterate](/wiki/Illiterate "Illiterate") [conduct](/wiki/Conduct "Conduct").[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) The possible labels are:

- "Apollo"
- "Moon Crunchy"
- "Snacky Cake"
- "Chocolate Nuggie"
- "The Small Bar"
- "Crispy Yum Yum"
- "Nilla Crunchie"
- "Berry Bar"
- "Choco Nummer"
- "Om-nom"
- "Fruity Oaty"
- "Wonka Bar"

## Strategy

Candy bars have a decent [nutrition/weight](/wiki/Nutrition/weight "Nutrition/weight") ratio at 50, the same as a [slime mold](/wiki/Slime_mold "Slime mold"), and for non-vegan characters it might be worth saving for consumption until after they have exhausted their rations. Characters not interested in eating them can use them to tame [domestic](/wiki/Domestic "Domestic") cats and dogs.

## History

The candy bar first appears in Hack for PDP-11, which is based on [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), and is included in the initial item list for [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0").

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Candy bar](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:Search/Candy_bar "wikipedia:Special:Search/Candy bar")***

A candy bar is a type of candy that is in the shape of a bar, with the chocolate bar being one of the more common types; a chocolate bar is either made of chocolate by itself or combined with other ingredients, such as nuts, caramel, nougat, or wafers. Many varieties of candy bars exist and are mass-produced, with approximately 40,000 brands introduced between World War I and the middle of the 20th century. The *NetHack* candy bar is presumably made of chocolate and/or other ingredients that use milk, hence its non-vegan status.

The encyclopedia entry comes from 1964 children's novel *[Charlie and the Chocolate Factory](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlie_and_the_Chocolate_Factory "wikipedia:Charlie and the Chocolate Factory")*, where the titular child wins a trip to the chocolate factory owned by the eccentric recluse Willy Wonka - Wonka also lends his name to a real-life brand of chocolate and candy, which one of the *NetHack* candy bar's label references alongside a few fictional brands from other popular media.

## Variants

### UnNetHack

[UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack") incorporates the [advent calendar](/wiki/Advent_calendar "Advent calendar") patch, which has a decently high chance of generating a candy bar as the treat behind each of the non-Christmas Eve doors.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), some candy bars may be randomly made of "rare candy" that increases the character's [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") by 1 when eaten. This is a reference to the *Pokémon* franchise, whose games include an item called the Rare Candy that acts as an instant level-up and sets the the Pokémon's experience to the minimum amount to gain the next level, similar to an uncursed [potion of gain level](/wiki/Potion_of_gain_level "Potion of gain level"); later games in the series introduce "Exp. Candy" items that grant set amounts of experience.

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), [Hackers](/wiki/Hacker "Hacker") start the game with 5 candy bars.

## Encyclopedia entry

Only once a year, on his birthday, did Charlie Bucket ever  
 get to taste a bit of chocolate. The whole family saved up  
 their money for that special occasion, and when the great  
 day arrived, Charlie was always presented with one small  
 chocolate bar to eat all by himself. And each time he  
 received it, on those marvelous birthday mornings, he would  
 place it carefully in a small wooden box that he owned, and  
 treasure it as though it were a bar of solid gold; and for  
 the next few days, he would allow himself only to look at it,  
 but never to touch it. Then at last, when he could stand it  
 no longer, he would peel back a tiny bit of the paper  
 wrapping at one corner to expose a tiny bit of chocolate, and  
 then he would take a tiny nibble - just enough to allow the  
 lovely sweet taste to spread out slowly over his tongue. The  
 next day, he would take another tiny nibble, and so on, and  
 so on. And in this way, Charlie would make his ten-cent bar  
 of birthday chocolate last him for more than a month.

\[ Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, by Roald Dahl ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 144](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L144)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/mkobj.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2219](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mkobj.c#L2219): *any comestible that can be randomly generated is eligible*
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/read.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 306](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/read.c#L306)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Candy bar

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 中文（中国大陆）‎
%
Name candy bar
Base price 10 zm
Nutrition 100
Turns to eat 1
Weight 2
Conduct vegetarian

A candy bar is a type of veggy comestible that appears in NetHack, and is suitable for vegetarians (but not vegans).

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Strategy
  • 4 History
  • 5 Origin
  • 6 Variants
    • 6.1 UnNetHack
    • 6.2 dNetHack
    • 6.3 SlashTHEM
  • 7 Encyclopedia entry
  • 8 References

Generation

Tourists may start with candy bars among their random food items.[1]

In addition to random generation, candy bars can be sold in health food shops and delis.

Applying a charged horn of plenty has a 1.3% chance of generating one or more candy bars.[2]

Description

When eaten, a candy bar confers 100 nutrition and takes one action to consume.

Candy bars have labels that can be read, which naturally breaks illiterate conduct.[3] The possible labels are:

  • "Apollo"
  • "Moon Crunchy"
  • "Snacky Cake"
  • "Chocolate Nuggie"
  • "The Small Bar"
  • "Crispy Yum Yum"
  • "Nilla Crunchie"
  • "Berry Bar"
  • "Choco Nummer"
  • "Om-nom"
  • "Fruity Oaty"
  • "Wonka Bar"

Strategy

Candy bars have a decent nutrition/weight ratio at 50, the same as a slime mold, and for non-vegan characters it might be worth saving for consumption until after they have exhausted their rations. Characters not interested in eating them can use them to tame domestic cats and dogs.

History

The candy bar first appears in Hack for PDP-11, which is based on Jay Fenlason's Hack, and is included in the initial item list for Hack 1.0.

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Candy bar

A candy bar is a type of candy that is in the shape of a bar, with the chocolate bar being one of the more common types; a chocolate bar is either made of chocolate by itself or combined with other ingredients, such as nuts, caramel, nougat, or wafers. Many varieties of candy bars exist and are mass-produced, with approximately 40,000 brands introduced between World War I and the middle of the 20th century. The NetHack candy bar is presumably made of chocolate and/or other ingredients that use milk, hence its non-vegan status.

The encyclopedia entry comes from 1964 children's novel Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, where the titular child wins a trip to the chocolate factory owned by the eccentric recluse Willy Wonka - Wonka also lends his name to a real-life brand of chocolate and candy, which one of the NetHack candy bar's label references alongside a few fictional brands from other popular media.

Variants

UnNetHack

UnNetHack incorporates the advent calendar patch, which has a decently high chance of generating a candy bar as the treat behind each of the non-Christmas Eve doors.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack, some candy bars may be randomly made of "rare candy" that increases the character's experience level by 1 when eaten. This is a reference to the Pokémon franchise, whose games include an item called the Rare Candy that acts as an instant level-up and sets the the Pokémon's experience to the minimum amount to gain the next level, similar to an uncursed potion of gain level; later games in the series introduce "Exp. Candy" items that grant set amounts of experience.

SlashTHEM

In SlashTHEM, Hackers start the game with 5 candy bars.

Encyclopedia entry

Only once a year, on his birthday, did Charlie Bucket ever
 get to taste a bit of chocolate. The whole family saved up
 their money for that special occasion, and when the great
 day arrived, Charlie was always presented with one small
 chocolate bar to eat all by himself. And each time he
 received it, on those marvelous birthday mornings, he would
 place it carefully in a small wooden box that he owned, and
 treasure it as though it were a bar of solid gold; and for
 the next few days, he would allow himself only to look at it,
 but never to touch it. Then at last, when he could stand it
 no longer, he would peel back a tiny bit of the paper
 wrapping at one corner to expose a tiny bit of chocolate, and
 then he would take a tiny nibble - just enough to allow the
 lovely sweet taste to spread out slowly over his tongue. The
 next day, he would take another tiny nibble, and so on, and
 so on. And in this way, Charlie would make his ten-cent bar
 of birthday chocolate last him for more than a month.

[ Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, by Roald Dahl ]

References

  1. ↑ src/u_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 144
  2. ↑ src/mkobj.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2219: any comestible that can be randomly generated is eligible
  3. ↑ src/read.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 306

A '''candy bar''' is a type of [[veggy]] [[comestible]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]'', and is suitable for [[vegetarian]]s (but not [[vegan]]s).

==Generation==
Tourists may start with candy bars among their random food items.{{refsrc|src/u_init.c|144|nethack=3.6.7}}

In addition to random generation, candy bars can be sold in health food [[shop]]s and delis.

[[Apply]]ing a [[charge]]d [[horn of plenty]] has a 1.3% chance of generating one or more candy bars.{{refsrc|src/mkobj.c|2219|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=any comestible that can be randomly generated is eligible}}

==Description==
When eaten, a candy bar confers 100 [[nutrition]] and takes one action to consume.

Candy bars have labels that can be [[read]], which naturally breaks [[illiterate]] [[conduct]].{{refsrc|src/read.c|306|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} The possible labels are:

* "Apollo"
* "Moon Crunchy"
* "Snacky Cake"
* "Chocolate Nuggie"
* "The Small Bar"
* "Crispy Yum Yum"
* "Nilla Crunchie"
* "Berry Bar"
* "Choco Nummer"
* "Om-nom"
* "Fruity Oaty"
* "Wonka Bar"

==Strategy==
Candy bars have a decent [[nutrition/weight]] ratio at 50, the same as a [[slime mold]], and for non-vegan characters it might be worth saving for consumption until after they have exhausted their rations. Characters not interested in eating them can use them to tame [[domestic]] cats and dogs.

==History==
The candy bar first appears in Hack for PDP-11, which is based on [[Jay Fenlason's Hack]], and is included in the initial item list for [[Hack 1.0]].

==Origin==
{{wikipedia}}
A candy bar is a type of candy that is in the shape of a bar, with the chocolate bar being one of the more common types; a chocolate bar is either made of chocolate by itself or combined with other ingredients, such as nuts, caramel, nougat, or wafers. Many varieties of candy bars exist and are mass-produced, with approximately 40,000 brands introduced between World War I and the middle of the 20th century. The ''NetHack'' candy bar is presumably made of chocolate and/or other ingredients that use milk, hence its non-vegan status.

The encyclopedia entry comes from 1964 children's novel ''[[wikipedia:Charlie and the Chocolate Factory|Charlie and the Chocolate Factory]]'', where the titular child wins a trip to the chocolate factory owned by the eccentric recluse Willy Wonka - Wonka also lends his name to a real-life brand of chocolate and candy, which one of the ''NetHack'' candy bar's label references alongside a few fictional brands from other popular media.

==Variants==

[[UnNetHack]] incorporates the [[advent calendar]] patch, which has a decently high chance of generating a candy bar as the treat behind each of the non-Christmas Eve doors.

===dNetHack===

This is a reference to the ''Pokémon'' franchise, whose games include an item called the Rare Candy that acts as an instant level-up and sets the the Pokémon's experience to the minimum amount to gain the next level, similar to an uncursed [[potion of gain level]]; later games in the series introduce "Exp. Candy" items that grant set amounts of experience.

===SlashTHEM===
In [[SlashTHEM]], [[Hacker]]s start the game with 5 candy bars.
